urls.description: Offices Open, With Cautionary Measures

tweets.text: To help slow the spread of COVID-19, we‚Äôve temporarily suspended in-person services at our offices until on or after June 4. We‚Äôll work towards reopening our offices with your safety & the safety of our workforce in mind. Read more about our operations: https://t.co/YAt68QsUCp

As the personnel of @DHSgov faithfully serve our nation despite an ongoing pandemic, whether on the frontlines or teleworking, I want to extend my gratitude to each of them during public service recognition week -- Thank you!

urls.title: Lock
urls.description: DHS‚Äôs efforts have facilitated a speedy, whole-of-government response in confronting COVID-19 to keep Americans safe.

tweets.text: Questions about the federal response to #coronavirus? Info on travel restrictions, critical infrastructure, PPE, and more on our webpage: https://t.co/rIcgjyNKiP

Our workforce is executing an unprecedented, whole-of America response to the #coronavirus pandemic. Take a look at just some of the ways we are fighting to #slowthespread and protect the homeland: https://t.co/aXeTewqOid

Visa Waiver Program (VWP) entrants are ineligible for extension of stay/change of status. However, if COVID-19 prevents departure of a VWP entrant, we are authorized to grant up to 30 days of satisfactory departure.

If filing an extension/change request after admission expires, we may excuse the delay if due to extraordinary circumstances, such as those caused by COVID-19. Petitioners/applicants must submit credible evidence in support. We will evaluate requests on a case-by-case basis.
We remind petitioners and applicants that we may excuse delays in filing extension/change of status requests based on extraordinary circumstances.

Generally, nonimmigrants are required to depart the U.S. before their authorized period of admission expires. If seeking to extend their stay or change their status, they must apply to do so before that expiration to be eligible for an extension or change.

During the COVID-19 pandemic, a top priority is protecting U.S. workers. We also are using our existing authorities to address immigration-related challenges as a direct result of the pandemic. 
https://t.co/3r3IgsgbEv

#Scammers are leveraging the #COVID19 pandemic to steal your money, your personal information, or both. Don‚Äôt let them. Learn how to protect yourself from #scams at ‚ÄØhttps://t.co/ZGlF23ZGDJ. https://t.co/WQdTzX2vTL

urls.title: Coronavirus Scams - Consumer Resources
urls.description: As the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic continues to impact the United States, phone scammers have seized the opportunity to prey on consumers

tweets.text: Scammers constantly adapt to prey on the vulnerable during crises ‚Äì and the #coronavirus pandemic is no exception. @FCC is warning consumers about numerous ongoing scams, from fake testing kits and unproven cures to government imposters. More: https://t.co/Fl5ijEhSXe

Think you might have #coronavirus? There‚Äôs an app for that. If you or someone in your family is exhibiting symptoms, download the Apple COVID-19 app, a free resource from @CDCgov that can help get diagnostic information to you immediately.

urls.title: USCIS Response to COVID-19
urls.description: Offices Open, With Cautionary Measures

tweets.text: Applicants who had an appointment scheduled w/ an ASC after the March 18 closure or filed an I-765 extension will have their application processed using previously submitted biometrics.  This will remain in effect until ASCs resume normal operations.  https://t.co/YAt68QsUCp

Today, we announced that we will reuse previously submitted biometrics in order to process valid I-765 (Application for Employment Authorization) extension requests due to the temporary closure of Application Support Centers (ASC) to the public in response to COVID-19.

This flexibility applies to an RFE, NOID, NOIR, NOIT or appealable decision within AAO jurisdiction and the issuance date listed on the request, notice or decision is between March 1, 2020 and May 1, 2020, inclusive.

Please Note: This flexibility also applies to certain Notices of Intent to Revoke (NOIR) and Notices of Intent to Terminate (NOIT) regional investment centers, as well as certain filing date requirements for Form I-290B, Notice of Appeal or Motion. https://t.co/U99qCQd6ei

urls.title: USCIS Response to COVID-19
urls.description: Offices Open, With Cautionary Measures

tweets.text: We are adopting several measures to protect our workforce and community, and to minimize the immigration consequences for those seeking immigration benefits during this time.  For more information, visit https://t.co/YAt68QsUCp.

To the brave men and women of @dhsgov:

Our country is now at an inflection point in history and our actions today will determine what's remembered for generations. As we face the challenges of the #coronavirus pandemic, know that you have my complete support and that of the Dept https://t.co/hkLA7EdUtZ

urls.title: How to Change Your Address
urls.description: We strongly encourage you to update your address with USCIS to ensure you receive all correspondence and benefits from us in a timely manner and avoid possible delays related to your case.

tweets.text: Update your address. Have you moved? Update your address with us to ensure you receive notices from USCIS on time and avoid possible delays or denials related to your immigration case. https://t.co/gjWy0LyrCw
Start gathering documents, such as your birth certificate, that you may need if you are preparing to file for #immigration benefits.

urls.title: myUSCIS
urls.description: myUSCIS provides a personalized account to help you navigate the immigration process. On myUSCIS, you will find: Up-to-date information about the application process for immigration benefits; Tools to help you prepare for filing and help finding citizenship preparation classes; and Information to help explore your immigration options.

tweets.text: Create a USCIS online account. It‚Äôs free and easy. It allows you to file online, track your case, and communicate electronically with USCIS. Visit https://t.co/pHIVKb8jrG to get started.

urls.title: Meet Emma, Our Virtual Assistant
urls.description: Meet ‚ÄúEmma,‚Äù a computer-generated assistant who can answer your questions and even take you to the right spot on our website.

tweets.text: Ask Emma. Emma, can answer questions you might have on #immigration.  Emma will also direct you to the right pages of our website for more detailed information. Think of her as a navigator. https://t.co/DAyPbcJXkr
During this time, there are many tools available to assist you. Here are 5 things you can do now.

urls.title: DHS announces flexibility in requirements related to Form I-9 compliance
urls.description: Employers who avail themselves of this option must provide written documentation of their remote onboarding and telework policy for each employee. This burden rests solely with the employers.

tweets.text: #FormI9: On March 20, @DHSgov and @ICEgov announced temporary flexibility of Form I-9 requirements for remote employees due to COVID-19. Learn more. https://t.co/4WGNX0UXJb
Hearing #coronavirus information from your friends? Stick to the facts from official sources to help keep you and your family safe! Check out @FEMA‚Äôs Rumor Control page: https://t.co/Hq7rUMD21J

Know the facts about #COVID19. Don‚Äôt share rumors & unintentionally spread misinformation. Federal, state & local governments are posting current and accurate information. For help in distinguishing rumor from fact, see @FEMA Coronavirus Rumor Control: https://t.co/Hi5AF1waWk https://t.co/AkbQjOM2xw

Hearing a lot about texts from "friends at DHS" or "friends with connections at DHS" that say DHS is planning a national lock down. 

THIS IS NOT TRUE. 

Do not believe the disinformation campaigns. Please do not pass it along. Use trusted local and federal government sources.

There has been a lot of misinformation spreading about the #COVID19 crisis. Please only rely on information published by official sources and sign up for the latest updates from your local & state officials. 

More: https://t.co/jjOoxC3LyF https://t.co/NjckJREDfk

We will process petitions with a previously accepted Form I-907, Request for Premium Processing Service, according to standard premium processing criteria. We will not be able to honor pre-paid envelopes and will only send batch-printed notices.

In response to COVID-19, we will immediately begin a temporary suspension of premium processing service for all Form I-129 and I-140 petitions until further notice. https://t.co/wppQgk8ItP https://t.co/63h3yv1AJu

The suspension of face-to-face services with applicants, including interviews, biometric appointments, and naturalization ceremonies, will be in place until at least April 1. Our field offices, asylum offices and Application Support Centers will be closed to the public.

urls.title: USCIS Response to COVID-19
urls.description: Offices Open, With Cautionary Measures

tweets.text: In an effort to protect our employees & communities, effective immediately, we'll no longer be providing in-person services at any of our offices. We'll continue operations & services that don't require in-person contact w/ the public. For more info visit: https://t.co/m3N1ZBE1Ez

A modified oath ceremony will include only statutory requirements and continue to honor the dignity of the occasion. Should a candidate wish to delay & participate in a full formal ceremony on a later date, the candidate should inform the interviewing officer.
Attendance at oath ceremonies will be limited to candidates only to allow for social distancing. An exception will be made for individuals requiring assistance or an interpreter.

urls.title: USCIS Contact Center
urls.description: Our website gives you several ways to track your case and get answers to your immigration questions. Track Your Case

tweets.text: If you don't wish to attend your naturalization interview at this time, or if you are ill, no need to contact us. We'll automatically reschedule your interview & send you a notice. If you don't receive a notice within 90 days, contact USCIS Contact Center: https://t.co/Rtgwmf8FbT

urls.title: USCIS Contact Center
urls.description: Our website gives you several ways to track your case and get answers to your immigration questions. Track Your Case

tweets.text: If your appointment or oath ceremony is cancelled, you will either receive an email or a mailed notice. If you don‚Äôt receive a new appointment notice within 90 days following a cancellation, please reach out to the USCIS Contact Center: https://t.co/Rtgwmf8FbT

We are taking measures to continue our mission while protecting the public & our employees. To ensure the health, safety & well-being of our workforce & comply w/ local policies, we may need to cancel & reschedule in-person appointments & oath ceremonies at field offices.

Additionally, those with appointments may only be accompanied by a/an interpreter, attorney, parent/legal guardian, or individual providing assistance to a disabled person. We also ask all visitors to observe the social distancing guidelines of remaining at least six feet apart.

In accordance with @CDCgov guidelines, we can only accommodate 50 individuals inside of an Application Support Center (ASC) at any one time (inclusive of staff). Therefore, we will not be able to accommodate walk-in visitors or unscheduled appointments.

urls.title: E-Verify is Business Friendly
urls.description: Official websites use .gov A.gov website belongs to an official government organization in the United States. Secure .gov websites use HTTPS A lock () or https:// means you've safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites. E-Verify gives you, the employer, peace of mind that your employees are legally authorized to work in the United States. You are required by law to complete Form I-9 for each newly hired employee, and E-Verify complements Form I-9

tweets.text: Growing  your business? Make sure you have the right partners to help you get there. #EVerify is your trusted employment eligibility verification partner, helping you confirm employment authorization. https://t.co/icr7UryHCL

urls.title: Community, Work, and School
urls.description: Actions that communities can take to slow the spread of COVID-19.

tweets.text: Reduce your risk of exposure to respiratory diseases, like #COVID19: wash hands often w/ soap & water for at least 20 seconds. Under the final rule, #USCIS will look at factors required under the law by Congress, such as an alien‚Äôs age, health, family status, assets, resources & financial status, education & skills, among others, to determine if the alien is likely at any time to become a public charge.

Our officers evaluate H-1B petitions on a case-by-case basis to decide if they meet all standards required under applicable laws & regulations. If you willfully misrepresent yourself on an H-1B visa application, you‚Äôll be inadmissible for entry into the U.S or charged with fraud.

We created & implemented the Targeted Site Visit and Verification Program (TSVVP) to enhance the integrity of the immigration benefit process. TSVVP allows us to focus resources where fraud & abuse of the H-1B program may be more likely to occur.

The H-1B visa program helps U.S. companies recruit highly skilled foreign nationals when there's a shortage of qualified workers in the U.S. Employers who abuse this program negatively affect U.S. workers, decreasing wages & opportunities as they import more foreign workers.

Despite recent successes, the border crisis is not over. The uniformed men and women of @CBP continue to enforce our laws despite the loopholes in those very same laws that make us vulnerable to illegal migration. https://t.co/UG3hGTDtQz

urls.title: Lock
urls.description: Official websites use .gov A.gov website belongs to an official government organization in the United States. Secure .gov websites use HTTPS A lock () or https:// means you‚Äôve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites. Blue Campaign is a national public awareness campaign designed to educate the public, law enforcement, and other industry partners to recognize the indicators of human trafficking, and how to appropriately respond to possible cases.

tweets.text: Individuals must first be free from trafficking in order to exercise all their inalienable rights. Learn more about how DHS is working to combat #humantrafficking. #NationalHumanTraffickingAwarenessDay #WearBlueDay  #FreedomFirst https://t.co/we4S0l55Ck https://t.co/exI1KmKIVm

The U visa is set aside for victims of certain crimes who've suffered mental or physical abuse & are helpful to law enforcement or government officials in the investigation or prosecution of criminal activity. U visa fraud takes resources away from those who need its protection.

The more we talk about trafficking, the more we can do to end it. This month take a moment to talk to someone about #humantrafficking to help raise awareness of the crime. #TalkAboutTrafficking https://t.co/WwCHW9yqeW

We‚Äôve announced in the Federal Register that there will be a registration requirement for H-1B cap subject petitioners for FY 2021. We‚Äôll open an initial registration period from March 1-20, 2020. https://t.co/q7sPizCgGi
We will work to resettle up to 18,000 refugees from around the world in FY 2020, in addition to the hundreds of thousands of asylum applicants the U.S. government will process in the same time.

In addition to accepting legitimate asylum seekers, the United States has some of the most generous humanitarian protection programs in the world. In FY 2019, @DHSgov and @TheJusticeDept granted asylum to nearly 47,000 individuals.
Under the direction of @DHSgov, and in partnership with @CBP and @ICEgov, we have instituted policies, regulations and practices aimed at shielding our asylum system from abuse and fraudulent claims.

Blue is internationally symbolic of #humantrafficking awareness. Join us in wearing blue on January 11th. Share your photo with #WearBlueDay to help raise awareness of this crime. https://t.co/SQ08fTQjr2 https://t.co/5kjouNkEQ4

Under U.S. law, asylum may be granted on the basis of nationality, political opinion, race, religion or membership in a particular social group. By law, economic migrants or those who seek to enter the U.S. solely to escape generalized violence do not qualify for asylum.

January is Human Trafficking Prevention Month. We‚Äôre raising awareness of #humantrafficking this (and every) month. Follow us and retweet our posts to help bring awareness to this crime. https://t.co/gLBbXRhhqN

We are working to maximize resources across the entire enterprise and employing a whole-of-government approach to confront the crisis and ensure those who need humanitarian assistance receive the protection that they deserve.
At the end of #FY19, we had nearly 340K affirmative asylum cases pending adjudication. In addition, we processed over 100K credible fear claims made at U.S. borders‚Äîa record high.
